title: Fix voice transcript accumulation — restart recognition task after each utterance
description:
Every voice prompt sent to the gateway contains the full accumulated transcript since listening started, not just the current utterance.

## Root Cause
In VoiceEngine.emitUtteranceIfValid():
1. Emits the transcript via onUtteranceComplete
2. Clears currentTranscript = ""
3. BUT does NOT restart the recognition task

SFSpeechRecognizer recognition tasks accumulate text for their entire lifetime. The next result.bestTranscriptionString callback restores the full accumulated text, overwriting the cleared currentTranscript.

## Fix
After emitting an utterance, restart the recognition task:
- Cancel and nil out the current recognitionTask and recognitionRequest
- Start a new recognition request immediately (so listening continues without interruption)
- The new task starts with an empty transcript

In emitUtteranceIfValid(), after clearing currentTranscript, call a restartRecognition() method that tears down the current task and starts a fresh one.

## Files
- Zaap/Zaap/VoiceEngine.swift: emitUtteranceIfValid(), add restartRecognition()

title: Mute mic while speaker is talking to prevent feedback loop
description:
The TTS speaker output is being picked up by the microphone, causing the assistant to respond to itself in a loop.

## Root Cause
VoiceEngine continues listening while ResponseSpeaker is playing TTS. The speaker audio feeds back into SFSpeechRecognizer.

## Fix
Pause/stop listening when the speaker starts talking, resume when it finishes.

In VoiceChatCoordinator:
- When speaker state changes to .speaking → call voiceEngine.stopListening()
- When speaker finishes (speakImmediate/flush completes) → call voiceEngine.startListening() if session is still active

ResponseSpeaker should notify when it finishes speaking. The delegate/callback pattern already exists (onUtteranceComplete in VoiceEngine). ResponseSpeaker needs a similar completion callback, OR VoiceChatCoordinator should check speaker.state before restarting the mic.

## Current flow (broken)
listening → transcript sent → speaking starts → mic still on → picks up TTS → loop

## Correct flow
listening → transcript sent → stop mic → speaking starts → speaking ends → resume mic

title: Replace voice connection handshake with new WebSocket protocol
description:
Implement the new WebSocket handshake protocol to replace the current voice connection handshake.

## Current State
The existing voice connection handshake needs to be replaced with a more robust WebSocket protocol.

## New Protocol Requirements

### Step 1: WebSocket Connection
- Connect to: wss://zanebot.tail66e5f8.ts.net

### Step 2: Challenge Handling  
- Receive challenge with nonce and timestamp from gateway
- Save nonce for signature generation

### Step 3: Device Identity (Ed25519)
- Generate Ed25519 keypair (one-time, persistent)
- deviceId = SHA-256 of raw public key bytes (hex)
- publicKey = raw 32-byte public key, base64url-encoded

### Step 4: Signature Generation (v3)
- Build payload: v3|deviceId|clientId|clientMode|role|scopes|signedAtMs|token|nonce|platform|deviceFamily
- Sign with Ed25519 private key
- Base64url encode signature

### Step 5: Connect Request
- Send structured connect request with auth, device, and signature details
- Handle pairing flow for new devices (code 1008)
- Store deviceToken for future connections

### Key Implementation Notes
- Use CryptoKit Curve25519.Signing for Ed25519 in Swift
- Store keypair in Keychain permanently  
- publicKey is raw 32 bytes base64url (not PEM)
- All string fields lowercase ASCII
- deviceToken can replace bearer token on subsequent connects

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WebSocket connection established
- [ ] Ed25519 keypair generation and storage
- [ ] Challenge/response flow implemented
- [ ] Signature generation working
- [ ] Connect request properly formatted
- [ ] Pairing flow handled
- [ ] deviceToken persistence
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures
notes: Worker made partial changes (v2→v3 signature) but missed the main requirement: implementing new WebSocket handshake to replace current voice connection. Need full protocol replacement per original spec.

Design: Voice chat — research gateway WS protocol and architect voice conversation feature
description:
Research and design the voice conversation feature for Zaap.

Goals:
- User opens voice tab, starts talking (no push-to-talk — use voice activity detection)
- SFSpeechRecognizer transcribes speech, detects end-of-utterance on silence
- Transcript sent to OpenClaw gateway, response streamed back
- AVSpeechSynthesizer speaks the response
- Conversation stays open for back-and-forth

Research needed:
1. Gateway WebSocket protocol — can Zaap connect as a node? The Android app already does this (ws://<host>:18789 with pairing). If Zaap implements the node protocol, it gets bidirectional chat for free.
2. Alternative: custom WS endpoint or synchronous hook response
3. iOS constraints: SFSpeechRecognizer continuous mode, background audio session, VAD silence detection thresholds
4. TTS voice selection — AVSpeechSynthesizer voices vs ElevenLabs API

Deliverable: Architecture doc in .braids/iterations/ with sequence diagrams, protocol choice, and implementation plan broken into sub-beads.
